name: Augmented Reality in JavaScript
description: Talk about how easy it can be to create augmented reality applications in JavaScript. Features tracking.js and other AR libraries! Has been delivered at Indy.Code() and as a lightning talk for Hack && Tell. Will also be given at NoVa Code Camp, CharmCityJS, and MidAtlantic Developers Conference this summer.

name: Learning CSS Through Creating Art
description: An introduction to CSS through creating art! Goes through color, positioning, shapes, and selectors. Full day version given at Indy.Code(). Has also been given as a dev.to talk and as a Pivotal Labs lunch and Learn. Will be given at the Art + Collective meetup this summer.

name: What are Web Frameworks?
description: A talk I gave at CodeHer Conference on what programmers mean when they talk about frameworks. It also goes into why different ones are used for different projects!

name: Programming 001
description: A talk I gave at ByteBack DC on what programming is and what code looks like compared to its output.

name: Creating Web-Ready Data Visualizations in Python using Bokeh
description: Guest lecture given to each of General Assembly's Data Science Immersive cohorts on Bokeh, a Python library for writing web-ready data visualizations.

name: Intro to React: State + Props, Event Handlers, and Conditionals
description: Introduction to React tutorial given at General Assembly's DC campus.

name: Intro to Git Using the CLI
description: Introduction to Git and GitHub from the command line given at the Women Who Code DC Meetup.

name: Intro to Web Development for Data Scientists
description: Guest lecture for General Assembly's data science program. Discusses how web development can be used to improve data science work, and attendees build a Flask app.

name: Starting a Blog as a Developer
description: An introduction to creating a programming blog.
